description: We’re a leading online reviews platform, free and open to all. Our mission is to be a universal symbol of trust. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead of us. Do you want to join us at the heart of trust?Do you want to be part of shaping Trustpilot at scale? Are you a solid software engineering manager with great interpersonal skills? Are you motivated to deliver value and enable others to grow? Then we want to hear from you!We are seeking an Engineering Manager who has extensive experience building great products and applications at scale, using the right technologies while focusing on delivering value for our users. We are looking for someone with at least a few years of experience developing software engineers and who knows how to grow them and make teams successful.At Trustpilot, we work as a team and deliver as a team. The environment that we cultivate includes working with great people who aid each other at every step, while at the same time pushing you to bring your A-game every day. Everyone’s opinion matters and you can help come up with the next big idea that will bring Trustpilot forward. Join our team and shape the way we work. Are you up for the challenge?What You’ll Be DoingOwn the delivery of major initiatives and balance delivery with sustainable engineering practices.Define, prioritise, and facilitate the implementation of deliverables that improve functionality to support business and customer needs.Facilitate cross-functional scoping, estimation, and feasibility tasks for intended solutionsManage and mitigate high-risk elements of initiatives, effectively communicate issues, risks, and dependencies with stakeholders, escalating where appropriate.Ensure teams have the appropriately high technical competence and aim for qualityDevelop and support a great team of skilled and motivated engineers, setting clear expectations via constant feedback and 1:1s practices.Collaborate with the engineering leadership to engage, develop and retain talent.Set up team members for success by creating growth opportunities, and addressing gaps in skills by mentoring and professional development coaching.Build a positive and high-performing work environment based on transparency, accountability, and trust.Who You AreSeveral years of Engineering Management experience on top of a solid technical background.Experience with cloud services, such as AWS, or Google CloudComprehensive knowledge of Agile MethodologyExperience with delivering scalable systems, and the ability to raise the bar.Experience coaching, mentoring, and growing individuals and teams.Extensive stakeholder management experience with a focus on working with the wider businessAbility to create alignment across teams.A desire to contribute to the future of Trustpilot, and the ability to make crucial technical decisions, in a pragmatic way.You enjoy cloud and SaaS platforms and enjoy leveraging the services it provides.Enthusiastic about We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!About TrustpilotAt Trustpilot, we’re passionate about our mission to offer a free and open to all review platform, built on collaboration. For consumers, we’re a place to connect with and influence businesses. For companies, we’re a platform for progress; a way to improve and innovate by engaging and collaborating with consumers.We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be a tangible symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations all around the world and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.Our purpose is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense.A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.Join us at the heart of trust.Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy. Vis mere Vis mindre

We’re a leading online reviews platform, free and open to all. Our mission is to be a universal symbol of trust. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead of us. Do you want to join us at the heart of trust?As we grow the Digital Marketing engineering team, we are looking for a skilled frontend engineer to join us in our London/ Copenhagen/ Edinburgh offices. The team owns a large part of Trustpilot’s online presence and collaboratively with marketeers, UI/UX designers and other engineers you will be working on our ever growing portfolio of business facing sites, implementing new features to enable our content managers and analysts and continuously deliver improvements.We are a team of around 30 Trusties supporting our global Commercial and Marketing departments. We have a presence in London, Copenhagen and New York and we are growing quickly to support the growing requirements of our Commercial and Marketing teams globally.We are responsible for the day to day management and overall health of our Commercial and Marketing Tech stack. We are accountable for all the integrations, data availability and deployment of change requests and new systems and technologies.What You’ll Be DoingClosely partner with product managers, designers and other engineers to deliver simple yet high impact designs and solutions which impact millions of users. Play a key part in defining and pursuing the team’s overall engineering improvements/initiatives Demonstrate solid knowledge of software engineering principles and best practices and their application within our technology stack, whilst focusing on continuous optimizations/iterations using an methodical approach Own projects from beginning to end and taking ownership of technical solutions. Collaborate with other engineers, marketeers, UI/UX designers and product managers to improve our ever growing portfolio of consumer facing applications Review and discuss code to promote knowledge sharing and find the best solutions to a given problem Who You Are4+ years’ engineering experience across JavaScript based tech stack (Typescript/Node.js) and React. Experience with Restful APIs, architecture and integrations Experience with AWS cloud ecosystem or similar cloud technologies. Knowledge and experience of Content Management System (CMS) integrations would be an added plus. Contentful or similar. Experience of leading engineering best practices (CI/CD, configuration management, test automation, observability, release management). Experience in deploying new technologies across multiple websites, including A/B testing platforms - Optimizely or similar. The ability to scope and implement individual-level technical solutions with minimal guidance to meet business requirements, whilst ensuring quality of code across the product. Motivation to deliver quality results in an agile, collaborative, ever-evolving environment. Enthusiasm for learning, both on their own and within a team, as well as the wish to communicate their own learnings to others. The Company:ViaBill operates at the intersection of the eCommerce, payments, and consumer credit sectors, and is an industry pioneer and early market entrant in the BNPL industry, which is experiencing explosive growth. Becoming the best at something isn’t easy. It takes skill, hard work, and an unmatched level of ambition and determination. Our team is international, experienced and most of all, hardworking. We come from Denmark, a country known for global companies and startups like TrustPilot, Vivino, and Zendesk - a list that will soon include ViaBill.In just a few short years, we’ve grown from our first office in an art gallery in Denmark to having our team located all over Europe. And now we’re on the hunt for exceptional talent to help us scale our business in Europe. From a handful of customers to handling transactions worth more than $150M per year, we aren’t afraid of new challenges and new markets. Our strategy has been validated with external investment from leading VCs Headline and BlackFin Capital Partners.We won’t lie, scale-ups take a lot of hard work. It takes something extraordinary to come out on top. And we want you to go the extra mile for the company – and yourself.“Opportunities multiply as they are seized.” – Sun TzuAre you ready to dive into a new challenge with a team of committed, motivated, and talented individuals seeking to build the biggest global point-of-sale financing solution?About The RoleViaBill is seeking for a Business Development Manager in Denmark with the grit and persistence to help us increase and secure our leadership position in this market. You will be joining at an essential and strategic time for ViaBill. Under the supervision of the Commercial Manager, you will have to negotiate with C-level contact at merchants.You have excellent communication skills and function well individually as well as a member of a team. Failure and rejection don’t scare you, as you’ve had experience with this before. You know that’s the name of the game.The position requires working in a dynamic and exceptionally fast-growing environment.What you will do:Build and nurture strong relationships to drive solutions and grow our merchant business by providing finance options to their customersAcquire key enterprise e-commerce merchants to provide ViaBill as a payment option for their customersDrive revenue and market share across a portfolio of merchantsTrack all activities, leads/campaigns, and reports using HubSpotWork cross-functionally with a variety of internal stakeholders on various strategic projects to optimize company outcomesManage key metrics to ensure pipeline development to meet revenue goalsBuild forecast, analysis and presentation to support your sales pitchesAbout you:You have an experience with B2B business development, e-commerce, and/or payments in DenmarkYou have strategic solid sales, research, analysis, presentation and negotiation skillsExperience working inside a high-growth-stage technology companyExceptional interpersonal and communication skills and ability to build relationships both internally and with external decision-makersA positive can-do attitude and growth mindsetYou have the desire to work in a fast-paced startup environmentYou speak Danish and English fluentlyWhat we offerA competitive package A fun, informal, and international working atmosphere with a bright, passionate and driven teamModern office in the absolute central historical part of Copenhagen KLunch, fruits and coffee in the officeEvents and Friday bar, champagne and beer tasting etcAbout our teamWe offer a job and environment with great potential for career development, freedom to unfold skills and competencies, and equal treatment. Everything is measured and backed up by numbers and data. If you are ready to learn, grow, and perform we are ready to reward you for your hard work and success.Our highly talented team consists of 20 different nationalities, is headquartered in Copenhagen (DK).SONOS sound-filled offices are centrally located in the historical center of Copenhagen. 80 professional and ambitious colleagues with an average age of 29, are eager to welcome you.Equal Opportunity Employer StatementAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. Elsker du at arbejde med de nyeste cloud-teknologier, og kan du se dig selv i en rolle, hvor du får stor indflydelse på tech-stacken, produktudvikling og den fremtidige retning for afdelingen? Så er du måske den nye cloud developer til Trelleborg i Århus!Som cloud developer hos Trelleborg vil du blive en del af et mindre team på 5 udviklere, som arbejder med udvikling af software til en række navigationsprodukter, der bruges rundt om i hele verden. Du vil få en stor del af ansvaret for de cloud-applikationer, som ligger i produktporteføljen, og du vil få stor indflydelse på den fremtidige udvikling.RollenDu vil i denne rolle komme til at arbejde agilt, hvor opgaverne fordeles i fællesskab, og der holdes løbende status. Cloud-løsningerne kører i dag i AWS og bliver bygget op i Go, og du vil få stor indflydelse på, hvordan løsningerne skal bygges op og hvilke værktøjer og teknologier, der skal bruges.Du vil få berøring med følgende teknologier i varierende grad:- AWS- Go- REST- JSON- NodeJS (legacy)- Angular (legacy)- React- MongoDB- SQL- MQTT- OpenGL- QT- C++- GitDatagrundlaget i produkterne består af geografiske data og sensordata fra den virkelige verden, og det behandles i realtid. Det er grunden til, at hardware-nære teknologier også er i spil i denne afdeling. Dit fokus vil dog være på de teknologier, som er relevante for Cloud-løsningerne.Dine arbejdsopgaver kan beskrives som følgende:- Udvikling af cloud-applikation- Ejerskab på et specifikt produkt, som du tager styringen på- Opsætning af test og code reviews- Bidrag til at sætte retningen for den fremtidige udviklingDet er en fleksibel arbejdsplads, hvor der er plads til at arbejde hjemmefra et par dage om ugen.Din profilFor at lykkes i denne rolle kræver det, at du har en passion for at arbejde med cloud. Du er nysgerrig og synes det er sjovt at eksperimentere med forskellige løsninger, indtil du finder den rigtige. Du er ansvarsbevidst og klar til at tage initiativ på de opgaver, som du sidder på.Du har en relevant uddannelse på kandidatniveau, f.eks datalogi, fysik, matematik eller civilingeniør. Du har stiftet et godt bekendtskab med cloud-løsninger i en tidligere rolle og gerne i en virksomhed, hvor der er en blanding af hardware og software.Du vil blive en del af en afdeling, der sætter pris på et godt arbejdsmiljø. Der bliver spillet bordfodbold i frokostpausen, der er aftener med spilcafé, fredagsbar, konferencer og meget mere. Der er også sat tid af hver fredag til at arbejde på et valgfrit projekt, som ligger uden for driften, så man kan dykke ned i nye teknologier eller arbejde på at forøge sine faglige kompetencer.Da Trelleborg er en international virksomhed, er der også mulighed for at komme med ud på kundebesøg i det omfang, det har interesse. Det kan både være ture på store skibe, konferencer over hele verden, en tur til Panama-kanalen eller nogle af de mange andre områder, hvor Trelleborg driver forretning.Om TrelleborgTrelleborg er en svensk ingeniørvirksomhed, der specialiserer sig i polymerteknologi og ingeniørløsninger til en bred vifte af industrier. Virksomheden blev grundlagt i 1905 og har hovedkontor i Trelleborg, Sverige.Trelleborgs produktportefølje omfatter tætninger, lejer, støddæmpere og andre specialiserede produkter lavet af højtydende materialer såsom gummi, plastik og kompositter. I Danmark har Trelleborg fokus på højteknologiske produkter inden for navigation såsom søkort, GPS-enheder og lignende.Vil du vide mere?Randstad varetager rekrutteringen på vegne af Trelleborg, og synes du, at stillingen lyder spændende, så send os dit CV via siden her. Vil du vide mere om jobbet og Trelleborg, er du velkommen til at kontakte seniorkonsulent Martin Pagh på +45 9292 0809 eller sourcing partner Julius Hauge på +45 4880 3450. Alle henvendelser behandles fortroligt, og vi kalder løbende ind til samtale.Om RandstadRandstad DK er en del af den internationale Randstad Group, som er verdens største udbyder af HR-løsninger. Med over 4.700 kontorer fordelt på 38 lande, formidler vi hver dag arbejde til mere end 650.000 mennesker verden over.I Danmark er vi blandt de førende vikar- og rekrutteringsbureauer med afdelinger i København, Aarhus, Aalborg og Kolding. En position, vi har opnået, fordi vi som eksperter på arbejdsmarkedet formår at matche kvalificerede kandidater med de rette jobmuligheder. Vis mere Vis mindre

At Too Good To Go, we dream of a planet with no food waste.We can all do our part in fighting food waste and do our bit to tackle climate change by reducing the amount of food wasted. Did you know, more than one-third of all food produced gets thrown away? This unnecessary food waste equates to 10% of greenhouse gas emissions!Too Good To Go is a food waste-fighting app and a certified B Corporation. We connect stores that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who buy and enjoy it. We save two meals every second, all thanks to our 2+ million daily users. We have over 68 million registered app users in 17 locations across Europe, the US and North America. Together, we have saved more than 183 million meals from going to waste. We are super proud of this, but there is still lots more that we want to achieve.The RoleWe are looking for a Software Developer - Backend, to be a part of our Product Teams that define, build and deliver our product features. As a Team Member in a product team, you will work towards specific outcomes with the freedom and responsibility to figure out the best way to achieve them together with the other Engineers and other Product Team members.Your mission will be to help refine, design, implement, deliver and maintain various product features.Your task will be to develop, build and deliver an international top-class product, ensuring quality, maintainability, and sustainability. Supported by more experienced colleagues who will guide, train and encourage you to push limits, and improve.The Tech StackWe have created a scalable Spring Boot Application running on Java 17 in Kubernetes deployed in a multi-region setup in AWS. Developers are able to run a full development environment locally, with all dependencies.ResponsibilitiesBuild and evolve our backend services and infrastructure to stay ahead of our growth curve. Develop exciting new features for our customers and businesses who partner with us. Actively participate in your team’s agile development processes with a continuous improvement mindset. Strive to deliver international top-class products with maximum quality, maintainability and scalability. Take on additional tasks outside your current boundaries with help from your team to continue to grow and expand your skills. The ideal candidateA wealth of experience in Backend development with the Java ecosystem.Proven production experience with Java, Spring, MySQL, Message System & GIT.Has worked with Domain Driven Design, and Clean, or Hexagonal- Architecture.Deep knowledge of AWS services (SQS, SNS, S3, …), ElasticSearch, Redis, Docker and Kubernetes.Experience with building scalable solutions.Enjoys actively participating in a cross-functional product team. \Takes pride in writing quality code.What We OfferAn opportunity to be a part of one of the Nordics’ most promising scale-ups, with HQ in Copenhagen. An autonomous environment, with several opportunities to contribute, build on experience and take ownership of your work in a way that works for you. A team of international co-workers, all on a global mission to reduce food waste. Opportunity to influence our product, design and ways of working, every day. Informal atmosphere. Modern Java platform using Spring Boot and Java 17, running in a K8S cloud environment. Robust Developer Tooling and CI/CD support. Interested?Now that we have caught your attention, it is time for you to catch ours. Please make sure to include your English resume and a simple 1-page cover letter telling us why you are the right fit for us. All applications are continuously evaluated.Our values# We fight together: food waste is a big beast to fight. We can do it if we fight together as Waste Warriors with no ego. We believe in a #oneteam.# We raise the bar: we always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers, and elevate one another.# We keep it simple: our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple# We build a legacy: we’re proud of the change we’re driving.# We care: we always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.How To ApplyWe take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.Job RefA Movement for EveryoneWe want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know. Vis mere Vis mindre

Job DescriptionSenior/Chief Statistical Analyst within Compliance Risk AssessmentsWould you like to progress your career within Group Compliance and have an important role in the development of Risk Assessments at Danske Bank? Join us on our journey toward becoming a better bank and assist us build an even stronger compliance set-up.Join the Risk Assessments TeamWithin Group Compliance, we identified a need to introduce a standard approach to risk assessments across all Compliance risk themes. We aim to ensure a sustainable programme is in place to keep risk assessments up to date and continuously able to identify and assess the risks and controls in a consistent way. The importance of this activity as a foundation of the Compliance Programme is paramount to the success of the Group Compliance department.The risk assessments are performed Group wide, covering all business areas that present Regulatory Compliance and Financial Crime risk exposure.We offer a hybrid work place – a combination between working from home and working in the office currently expected to be three days a week. The office location for this position is in Høje Taastrup or Helsinki.Engage with stakeholders and evolving risk responsibilityIn order to facilitate the gathering and analysis of information on scale; and to quantify, analyse and present risk exposure and control effectiveness, the risk assessment teams require the appropriate tools and technology. Working closely with risk assessment and IT teams, we are looking for a Senior/Chief Statistical Analyst to lead the development of survey applications, scoring model, reporting and data visualisation. Your tasks will include proactively driving the development of tools and technology through:Working with SQL – SQL Server Management Studio and related data warehousing environment.Developing new and adapting existing Risk Assessment Scoring Models via SQL and Alteryx.Data Modelling - Managing/manipulating data from multiple sources to generate meaningful MIS and BI in both Power BI and Tableau.Leading the tools and technology workstream, managing the relationship between IT and risk assessment teams.Support a dynamic and enthusiastic teamYou will be responsible for supporting the Risk Assessment Team and we imagine that you are comfortable to work and figure things out independently and can shape your own agenda whilst also brining the following to the table:Greater than 5 years’ experience working within the financial services sector.Strong Data Management/ETL, SQL, MS Access/MS Excel development – advanced formula and VBA skills.Solid knowledge and experience of working within or supporting large projects (risk assessments and/or compliance testing, thematic reviews, projects or audits is desirable).Experience with Python and/or Alteryx is desirable.We see you as someone who is self-motivated and self-driven, with demonstrated ability to develop new skills whilst keeping the existing ones up to date. You have extensive communication skills and are fluent in English in both verbal and writing.Why join us?You will become a part of a journey to build an even more collaborative, innovative and engaging culture. A culture where we empower all in Group Compliance to take ownership of how we work and how we develop. Our leaders are responsible for inspiring their employees to achieve their goals and to grow personally and professionally. If you can see yourself, thriving in a fun, diverse, business-aware and outcome-centric Compliance department - now is the time to join!Interested?Send us your CV and a cover letter in English! Please note that we are processing applications on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.We are looking forward to receiving your application!About UsDanske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us.
